unnormalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Sees a Big Boost**
normalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Sees a Big Boost**

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Exciting news on the environmental front. India's renewable energy sector is buzzing like a Diwali sparkler!
normalised: Hey everyone! Exciting news on the environmental front. India's renewable energy sector is buzzing like a Diwali sparkler!

unnormalised: A new report from TERI (The Energy and Resources Institute) shows a significant increase in solar power adoption in Rajasthan, especially among rural communities. Dr. Sharma, a leading researcher, highlighted that solar panels are now powering irrigation pumps and households in villages 50 km outside Jaipur.
normalised: A new report from T E R I (The Energy and Resources Institute) shows a significant increase in solar power adoption in Rajasthan, especially among rural communities. Doctor Sharma, a leading researcher, highlighted that solar panels are now powering irrigation pumps and households in villages fifty kilometer outside Jaipur.

unnormalised: This is helping farmers like Ramlal save big on electricity bills, sometimes as much as Rs. 5000 per month. Plus, a new wind farm near Kanyakumari, covering an area of 200 sq ft, is expected to generate enough electricity to power almost a lakh homes!
normalised: This is helping farmers like Ramlal save big on electricity bills, sometimes as much as rupee five thousand per month. Plus, a new wind farm near Kanyakumari, covering an area of two hundred square feet, is expected to generate enough electricity to power almost one lakh homes!

unnormalised: The government is also offering subsidies and tax breaks to encourage further investment in the sector. Seems like India is really embracing a greener future, one solar panel and wind turbine at a time! This is all great progress!
normalised: The government is also offering subsidies and tax breaks to encourage further investment in the sector. Seems like India is really embracing a greener future, one solar panel and wind turbine at a time! This is all great progress!
